name: UBERMOSH:BLACK
description: UBERMOSH:BLACK is the second volume of the arcade series UBERMOSH. Cut bullets with your sword, shoot with heavy guns and splatter enemies with a rage fueled psionic wave.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 2.5Ghz+ Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: 1GB DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 420 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Same Formula as the previous UBERMOSH game. So if you played UBERMOSH. You'll be able to beat it in an hour or two. Would be cool if there was an endless mode or a co-op mode or something. Still a good game to pass the time.

This has to be the most intense game on Steam. Every instance is loaded with a blur of Matrix worthy bullet dodging, endless pools of blood, and the thunder of the music pounding through your very soul. Finishing an event always ends with you on the edge of your seat, eyes locked to the screen, and your heart pumping adrenaline through you veins, as a rush of exhilaration comes over you at climax, with a victory so satisfying, you have to do it again.

UBERMOSH is a arcade style shooter/swordplay, i find it very highly addictive due to trying to beat my highscores over and over! It is also very tactical by trying to shoot/slash/dodge all at once. UBERMOSH is a beautifully done masterpiece, i really recommend the UBERMOSH Collection. There's no sense in biting half of a desilicious cookie when you can have a whole bundle instead.
very good game very fun to play

This is a game you sharpen your reflexes on. It's simply a twitch reaction top-down shooter and it makes no attempt to be anything other than that. There are a handful of classes for small bit of variance in how you'll spend the next few seconds and it's easy to dial into with its art style and music.  You won't be racking up countless hours in this game, but the time you do spend is very focused and highly entertaining.

UBERMOSH:BLACK is a slightly improved version of UBERMOSH, with not much else to add. It's still fun as ♥♥♥♥, but i can't review it as it's barely a new thing compared to the original.  10/10 ~People should play this.
Played it for 12 minutes, automatically know this is great
